ANU.name: NTINA Tzouvala
expertise: International Law Excl. International Trade Law
Legal Theory Jurisprudence And Legal Interpretation
Property Law Excl. Intellectual Property Law
interest: History and theory of international law; Third World Approaches to International Law (TWAIL); law and political economy; critical legal theory; feminist and queer legal theory; law, race and capitalism.
ANU.biography: Ntina is a member of the editorial collective of the Third World Approaches to International Law Review. In early 2020, she was appointed Senior Advisor to the UN Special Rapporteur on the Right to Food.

Microsoft-Academic.title: world trade and investment law reimagined a progressive agenda for an inclusive globalization

a false promise regulating land grabbing and the post colonial state
twail and the unwilling or unable doctrine continuities and ruptures
the ordo liberal origins of modern international investment law constructing competition on a global scale
the academic debate about mega regionals and international lawyers legalism as critique
capitalism as civilisation a history of international law
crowd drafting designing a human rights compatible international investment agreement
these ancient arenas of racial struggles international law and the balkans 1878 1949
the extraterritoriality of law history theory politics
